title: Lesson 1: Foundations of Japanese Vocabulary
description: Build a strong base in essential vocabulary for everyday life.

steps.title: Step 1: Greetings and Basic Expressions
steps.content: Learn common greetings and polite expressions.

vocabularies.whenToSay: Use this to greet someone during the day (Hello).
Say this to thank someone (Thank you).
Use this to say the number 1.
Use this to say the number 2.
Use this to say the number 3.

steps.title: Step 3: Everyday Objects
steps.content: Learn words for common everyday items.

vocabularies.whenToSay: Use this to refer to a book.
Use this to refer to a car.
Use this to refer to a clock or watch.

steps.title: Step 4: Family and Relationships
steps.content: Learn words for family members and relationships.

vocabularies.whenToSay: Use this to refer to your mother.
Use this to refer to your father.
Use this to refer to your older brother.

title: Lesson 2: Everyday Life Vocabulary
description: Learn essential words for navigating daily activities.
content: This lesson covers daily routines, family terms, and places around town.

steps.title: Step 1: Daily Routines and Activities
steps.content: Learn vocabulary for daily activities like 食べる (taberu - to eat), 飲む (nomu - to drink), and 行く (iku - to go), as well as time-related expressions such as 今 (ima - now) and 今日 (kyou - today).

vocabularies.example: ご飯を食べる (Gohan o taberu) - Eat rice.
水を飲む (Mizu o nomu) - Drink water.

steps.title: Step 2: Family and Relationships
steps.content: Learn family terms like 母 (haha - mother) and 父 (chichi - father), along with honorific forms like お母さん (okaasan - mother, formal).

vocabularies.example: 私の母 (Watashi no haha) - My mother.
お母さんが好きです (Okaasan ga suki desu) - I like my mom.

steps.title: Step 3: Places Around Town
steps.content: Expand vocabulary with words like 駅 (eki - station) and 学校 (gakkou - school), and practice directional phrases like 右 (migi - right) and 左 (hidari - left).

vocabularies.example: 駅に行く (Eki ni iku) - Go to the station.
学校で勉強する (Gakkou de benkyou suru) - Study at school.

steps.title: Step 4: Complete Lesson
steps.content: Write a short paragraph describing your daily routine and practice asking for directions.

title: Lesson 3: Food and Shopping Vocabulary
description: Understand words and phrases for food, dining, and shopping.
content: This lesson focuses on food-related vocabulary and phrases for shopping and payments.

steps.title: Step 1: Food Vocabulary
steps.content: Learn common food items like ご飯 (gohan - rice), 肉 (niku - meat), and 野菜 (yasai - vegetables), and phrases like 美味しい (oishii - delicious).

vocabularies.example: 私はご飯を食べます。 (Watashi wa gohan o tabemasu. - I eat rice.)
彼は肉が好きです。 (Kare wa niku ga suki desu. - He likes meat.)
このスープは美味しいです。 (Kono suupu wa oishii desu. - This soup is delicious.)

steps.title: Step 2: Shopping Terms
steps.content: Understand terms like 値段 (nedan - price) and 買う (kau - to buy), and phrases like いくらですか？ (Ikura desu ka? - How much is it?).

vocabularies.example: この商品の値段は何ですか？ (Kono shouhin no nedan wa nan desu ka? - What is the price of this item?)
私はこの本を買いたいです。 (Watashi wa kono hon o kaitai desu. - I want to buy this book.)
このリンゴはいくらですか？ (Kono ringo wa ikura desu ka? - How much is this apple?)

steps.title: Step 3: Currency and Payment
steps.content: Learn currency-related terms like 千円 (sen'en - 1000 yen) and basic math for calculating totals.

vocabularies.example: これは千円です。 (Kore wa sen'en desu. - This is 1000 yen.)
日本のお金は円です。 (Nihon no okane wa en desu. - Japanese currency is yen.)

steps.title: Step 4: Complete Lesson
steps.content: Role-play ordering food in a restaurant and simulate shopping for items in a store.

title: Lesson 4: Advanced Vocabulary and Cultural Nuances
description: Expand vocabulary and understand cultural contexts.
content: This lesson explores idiomatic expressions, hobbies, and cultural phrases.

steps.title: Step 1: Idiomatic Expressions
steps.content: Learn phrases like 頑張って (ganbatte - Good luck) and よろしくお願いします (yoroshiku onegaishimasu - Please take care of me).

vocabularies.example: 試験を頑張って！ (Shiken o ganbatte! - Good luck on your exam.)

vocabularies.phrase: よろしくお願いします
vocabularies.example: どうぞよろしくお願いします。 (Douzo yoroshiku onegaishimasu. - Please take care of me.)

steps.title: Step 2: Hobbies and Interests
steps.content: Explore vocabulary like 音楽 (ongaku - music) and 映画 (eiga - movie), and practice phrases like 好きですか？ (Suki desu ka? - Do you like it?).

vocabularies.example: 私は音楽を聴くのが好きです。 (Watashi wa ongaku o kiku no ga suki desu. - I like listening to music.)
最近、いい映画を観ましたか？ (Saikin, ii eiga o mimashita ka? - Have you seen any good movies recently?)
この映画は好きですか？ (Kono eiga wa suki desu ka? - Do you like this movie?)

steps.title: Step 3: Cultural Phrases and Etiquette
steps.content: Learn expressions of gratitude like ご馳走様 (gochisousama - Thank you for the meal) and apologies like すみません (sumimasen - Excuse me).

vocabularies.example: ご馳走様でした。 (Gochisousama deshita. - Thank you for the meal.)
すみません、道を教えてください。 (Sumimasen, michi o oshiete kudasai. - Excuse me, can you tell me the way?)

steps.title: Step 4: Complete Lesson
steps.content: Write a short paragraph about your favorite hobby and discuss cultural differences using learned vocabulary.
